clinical_study.brief_title: Echocardiography Findings and Perioperative Outcomes in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Echocardiography Findings and Perioperative Outcomes in Children Undergoing Congenital Heart Surgery: Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the association between perioperative echocardiographic Doppler findings and clinical outcomes in pediatric patients undergoing cardiac surgery. In our center, anesthesiologists perform transthoracic or transesophageal echocardiography during perioperative period routinely in children undergoing surgery for congenital cardiac disease. Echocardiographic findings include the doppler patterns of hepatic vein, portal vein, renal artery, renal vein and splenic vein before and after cardiopulmonary bypass. Portal pulsatility index, renal resistive index, and respiratory variations in peak aortic blood flow velocity and diameter of inferior vena cava are measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Characteristics of Doppler values and its derived parameters of portal vein, hepatic vein, renal artery and vein, and splenic vein measured using echocardiography in children with congenital cardiac disease
primary_outcome.time_frame: after anesthetic induction until the end of surgery
primary_outcome.description: To find the characteristics and standard values of Doppler findings measured by echocardiography before and after congenital cardiac surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Association between Doppler values measured by echocardiography and clinical outcomes after pediatric cardiac surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average 1-2 years
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate whether Doppler values of portal vein, hepatic vein, renal artery and vein, and splenic vein measured using echocardiography can predict major adverse outcomes after pediatric cardiac surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with major adverse outcomes after pediatric cardiac surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average 1-2 years

arm_group.description: Children with congenital cardiac disease who undergoing surgery

intervention.description: Echocardiographic examination before and after cardiopulmonary bypass

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All pediatric patients undergoing cardiac surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Applying extracorporeal membrane oxygenator prior to surgery
- Trouble applying echocardiography
